ca.ualberta.t14.gametrader

Class FileIO

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.ualberta.t14.gametrader.FileIO
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Friends, PictureManager, PictureNetworker, SettingsMode, Trade, TradeNetworker, User

    public class FileIO
extends java.lang.Object
    This class deals with writing and loading files. It has also static methods for universal access of common unversal file operations. On 11/3/2015.

    • Method Detail

      • saveJson

        public void saveJson(java.lang.String fileName,
            Context context)
        Saves an object to android's internal storage in json format, to use simply provide a filename which is just a string. The openFileOutput depends on context, when using in an activity/view pass it the parameter getApplicationContext().
        Parameters:
        fileName - - String to name the file you want to create
        context - - getApplicationContext()

      • loadJson

        public java.lang.Object loadJson(java.lang.String fileName,
                        Context context)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a single object, this works with all models: game, user, inventory... converts json back to object form, and returns that object back. use case: User x = new User(); x = (User) x.loadJson("FileNameOfUserObject", getApplicationContext); x will now be loaded with the object stored in memory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - String of the filename that exists, so that you can load an object.
        context - - getApplicationContext();
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • saveJsonWithObject

        public static void saveJsonWithObject(java.lang.Object objectToSaveInJson,
                      java.lang.String fileName,
                      Context context)
        A function that saves a given object to android's internal storage in json format, to use simply provide a filename which is just a string. The openFileOutput depends on context, when using in an activity/view pass it the parameter getApplicationContext().
        Parameters:
        fileName - - String to name the file you want to create
        context - - getApplicationContext()

      • loadJsonGivenObject

        public static java.lang.Object loadJsonGivenObject(java.lang.String fileName,
                                   Context context,
                                   java.lang.Object objectToGetClass)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Loads a single object of given class, this works with all models: game, user, inventory... converts json back to object form, and returns that object back. use case: User x = new User(); x = (User) x.loadJson("FileNameOfUserObject", getApplicationContext); x will now be loaded with the object stored in memory.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - String of the filename that exists, so that you can load an object.
        context - - getApplicationContext();
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • removeFile

        public static boolean removeFile(java.lang.String fileName,
                 Context context)
        This method checks if file exists and if so removes it.
        Parameters:
        fileName - - String of the filename that you want to remove.
        context - - getApplicationContext();
        Returns:
        Returns true if successfully removed file. Returns false if removal failed, or file does not exist.

      • doesFileExist

        public static boolean doesFileExist(java.lang.String fileName,

        This static function checks if the file exists, returns true if it does, and false if it doesn't.
        Parameters:
        context - - see above methods
        fileName - -see above methods
        Returns:
